snippet: Muslims across the United States say they are experiencing a wave of death threats, assaults and vandalism unlike anything they have experienced since the aftermath of Sept. 11.
abstract: Muslims and leaders of mosques across United States are reporting assaults, vandalism and receiving death threats in wake of San Bernardino, Calif, attacks; say intensity of backlash against Muslims is greater than any they have experienced since Sept 11 attacks in 2001.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Julie Turkewitz, Ian Lovett, Manny Fernandez and Ryan Schuessler.

lead_paragraph: Muslims across the United States say they are experiencing a wave of death threats, assaults and vandalism unlike anything they have experienced since the aftermath of Sept. 11.

headline.main: Muslims in America Condemn Extremists and Fear Anew for Their Lives
headline.print_headline: Muslims in America Condemn Extremists and Fear Anew for Their Lives
